roleset.name: attach, fastening, secured with a lock
roleset.note: LOCK-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls tape-22.4. (from lock.01-v)
LOCKED-J NOTES: Added by julia based on BOLT. (from locked.01-j)

example.name: lock-v: passive
example.text: ``Then they said, `By the way, [two of the doors]-1 are locked *trace*-1.'''

example.name: lock-v: two things connected
example.text: He said the move toward standard operating systems means customers-1 aren't locked *trace*-1 into buying from their traditional computer supplier and can force prices down.
example.arg: into buying from their traditional computer supplier

example.name: lock-v: with instrument
example.text: John locked his expensive bike with 50 yards of dental floss.

example.name: locking-n: Arg0,1
example.text: His locking the doors has forced me to stay with the neighbors because I can't get in the house.

example.name: lock_in-v: transitive
example.text: Most other supercomputer manufacturers have yet to adopt the Posix standard, Mr. Paluck said, adding that they prefer to maintain proprietary systems that *trace* lock in customers.

example.name: lock_in-v: with attribute
example.text: When it occurs, the traders place orders via computers to buy the basket of stocks in whichever market is cheaper and sell them in the more expensive market; they lock in the difference in price as profit.

example.name: lock_up-v: criminal intent
example.text: John-1 was locked up *trace*-1 as a menace to society.

example.name: lock_up-v: got it
example.text: In any settlement, Warner is almost certain to demand rights to most of the 50 or so projects *trace* Mr. Guber and Mr. Peters have locked up *trace* for the next few years, notably sequels to ``Batman.''

example.name: lock_up-v: sieze up; ergative with GOL
example.text: I 'm using VISTA and no pro but I 've noticed no functional improvements and VISTA has had the disconcerting habit of *PRO* locking up on me .

roleset.name: exclude, locked _out
roleset.note: LOCKED_OUT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from locked.05-j)

example.name: lock_out-v: transitive
example.text: The risk is that Jaguar's share price could slump if GM's agreement with Jaguar effectively locks out its U.S. rival.

example.name: lock_out-v: oops
example.text: John-1 was locked out *trace*-1 of his house.

example.name: lock_out-v: transitive
example.text: The risk is that Jaguar's share price could slump if GM's agreement with Jaguar effectively locks out its U.S. rival.

example.name: locked_out-j
example.text: Cool i ll see you at two . Wan na come by my place before two ? I 'm currently locked out but I 'm hoping to remedy that

roleset.name: secure
roleset.note: LOCK_DOWN-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from lock.06-v)

example.name: lock_down-v: secure
example.text: ...we-1 want *PRO*-1 to lock down a security situation...
